paragraphs: On Tuesday afternoon, September 9, a mass accident occurred on highway I/9 near the town of Melnik (Central Bohemian Region). A suburban bus with the ID number collided with a car that had started to brake in front of it along with the traffic flow. As a result of the ensuing chain of collisions, 5 cars were damaged.

In a mass car accident, 11 people were injured. One of them sustained severe injuries (he was transported by helicopter to the Central Military Hospital in Prague) and one suffered moderate injuries, while the others escaped with minor bruises and scrapes.
The incident occurred around 15:00 near the village of Koyetitse. According to the information provided, there were 14 passengers on the bus.
"The driver pointed out a malfunction in the braking system, however, this fact will be subject to further investigation," said police representative Pavel Truksa.
